titleStmt.title: Description of Folger Shakespeare Library, MS V.a.102: Latinae linguae elegantiarum compendium ... etc. manuscript, ca. 1455.

notesStmt.note: Title supplied by cataloger from title page (leaf 2r).
Contents of work written on second front endleaf: Laurentii Valla Elegantiarum linguae Latinae liber / Orosius de situ regionum / De punctandi genere.
Ricci, S. de. Census of medieval and Renaissance manuscripts in the United States and Canada, SM.6
The printing press as an agent of change. Eisenstein, Elizabeth L. Cambridge [Eng.] ; New York : Cambridge University Press, 1997, c1979, p. 52.
Warner, Chris. "Quick Eloquence in the Late Renaissance: Agostino Dati's Elegantiolae." Humanistica Lovaniensia: The Neo-Latin Journal, v. 61 (2012).

msContents.summary: Contains Elegantiolae, Dati's popular manual on the grammar and style of Latin, attributed in manuscript to Lorenzo Valla; a section of text from Orosius's Histories against the Pagans; and a short treatise on punctuation.

msItem.title: Latinae linguae elegantiarum compendium ... etc. manuscript, ca. 1455.
msItem.author: Dati, Agostino, 1420-1478, author.
Valla, Lorenzo, 1407-1457, attributed name.

respStmt.persName: Smedley, William T. (William Thomas), 1851-1934, former owner.
Folger, Emily C. J. (Emily Clara Jordan), 1858-1936, former owner.

msItem.title: Contents of work written on second front endleaf: Laurentii Valla Elegantiarum linguae Latinae liber / Orosius de situ regionum / De punctandi genere.
Elegantiolae
msItem.explicit: ... studia complectere, et quae indies assequere ad excecitationi accommoda. Finis. (f. 28r)

msItem.title: Orosius's Histories against the Pagans [section]
msItem.incipit: Quoniam regionum situm scientiam hec ad intelligendas hystorias utile est descriptiones eas ponere duxi ...
msItem.explicit: ... dicitur Narbonensis, pares media Lugdunensis. Finis. (f. 41v)

msItem.title: A short treatise on punctuation.
msItem.incipit: Positivia diffinit Isodorus esse figuram ad distinguendo sensus per cola, comata, et periodos ...
msItem.explicit: ... sursum versus dexteria ut notetur ad huic pendere vocabulum ad silabam quae sequitur. Finis. (f. 43r)

p.signatures: Verso of last leaves of signatures 2-4 marked A-C.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 27 long lines (dimensions of written space: 145 x 85 mm)Ì¤; above line; ruled in lead: pricks for vertical lines, horizontal lines traced in ink; marginal notes in green and purple ink throughout.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian Humanistic Cursive script, late 15th century.

decoDesc.decoNote: Title page has a marble edifice, with the inscription: Laurentii Vallae viri clarissimi latinae linguae elegantiarum compendium (leaf 2r); Coat of arms of the Schioppo family of Verona, with two putti (leaf 3r); Blue, red, green and gold major initials on leaves 3r and 30r; Alternating blue and red initials throughout 2nd work.
Inside front coverBook label, From the Collection of Charles Butler
2rTitle page has a marble edifice, with the inscription: Laurentii Vallae viri clarissimi latinae linguae elegantiarum compendium
3rCoat of arms of the Schioppo family of Verona, with two putti
3rBlue, red, green and gold 4-line initial C
30rBlue, red, green and gold 3-line initial Q

binding.p: Bound in diced Russia calfskin leather by R.P. Chilliat, ca. 1810, with gold tooling including the spine and turn-ins; with marbled endpapers and gilt edges.

origin.p: Text was copied by Cristoforo Schioppo of Verona, and probably produced in Italy, near the end of the 15th century; ca. 1455

history.provenance: Formerly owned by Phillipps; Charles Butler (bookplate); and W.T. Smedley (bookplate). Purchased as part of the Smedley Collection in 1924 by Henry Clay Folger.

keywords.term: Latin language --Terms and phrases --Early works to 1800 --Manuscripts
Chilliat, R. P. active early 19th-century, binder
